record.generate: Only when string is high entropy

record.description: Reserved - a packet tag MUST NOT have this packet type ID
Symmetrically Encrypted and Integrity Protected Data Packet
Preferred Symmetric Ciphers for v1 SEIPD

registry.title: OpenPGP Key Server Preference Flags
registry.note: This is a variable length bit field.

record.definition: The keyholder requests that this key only be modified or updated by the keyholder or an administrator of the key server.

record.description: No reason specified (key revocations or cert revocations)
Key material has been compromised (key revocations)
Key is retired and no longer used (key revocations)
User ID information is no longer valid (cert revocations)

registry.title: OpenPGP Features Flags
registry.note: This is a variable length bit field.

record.description: Symmetrically Encrypted Integrity Protected Data packet version 1
Symmetrically Encrypted Integrity Protected Data packet version 2

registry.title: OpenPGP New Packet Versions (OBSOLETE)
registry.note: Those wishing to use the removed "New Packet Versions" registry should instead register new versions of the relevant packets in the "OpenPGP Key and Signature Versions", "OpenPGP Key ID and Fingerprint" and "OpenPGP Encrypted Message Packet Versions" registries.

registry.title: OpenPGP Key Flags
registry.note: This is a variable length bit field.

record.description: This key may be used to make User ID certifications (signature type IDs 0x10-0x13) or direct key signatures (signature type ID 0x1F) over other keys.
This key may be used to sign data.
This key may be used to encrypt communications.
This key may be used to encrypt storage.
The private component of this key may have been split by a secret-sharing mechanism.
This key may be used for authentication.
The private component of this key may be in the possession of more than one person.

record.pkesk: MPI(g**k mod p), MPI (m * y**k mod p) RFC-ietf-openpgp-crypto-refresh-13, Section 5.1.4

record.public: MPI(p), MPI(q), MPI(g), MPI(y) RFC-ietf-openpgp-crypto-refresh-13, Section 5.5.5.2
OID, MPI(point in curve-specific point format), KDFParams [see RFC-ietf-openpgp-crypto-refresh-13, Sections 9.2.1, 5.5.5.6]
record.secret: MPI(value in curve-specific format) RFC-ietf-openpgp-crypto-refresh-13, Section 9.2.1
record.pkesk: MPI(point in curve-specific point format), size octet, encoded key RFC-ietf-openpgp-crypto-refresh-13, Sections 9.2.1, 5.1.5, 11.5

record.public: OID, MPI(point in SEC1 format) RFC-ietf-openpgp-crypto-refresh-13, Section 5.5.5.4

record.description: Reserved for Diffie-Hellman (X9.42, as defined for IETF-S/MIME)

record.public: OOID, MPI(point in prefixed native format) [see RFC-ietf-openpgp-crypto-refresh-13, Sections 11.2.2, 5.5.5.5]
record.secret: MPI(value in curve-specific format) [see RFC-ietf-openpgp-crypto-refresh-13, Section 9.2.1]

record.pkesk: 32 octets, size octet, encoded key [see RFC-ietf-openpgp-crypto-refresh-13, Section 5.1.6]
56 octets, size octet, encoded key [see RFC-ietf-openpgp-crypto-refresh-13, Section 5.1.7]

registry.title: OpenPGP Symmetric Key Algorithms
registry.note:
When registering a new symmetric cipher with a block size of 64 or 128 bits and a key size that is a multiple of 64 bits, no new considerations are needed.
If the new cipher has a different block size, there needs to be additional documentation describing how to use the cipher in CFB mode.
If the new cipher has an unusual key size, then padding needs to be considered for X25519 and X448 keywrap, which currently needs no padding.

record.xref: Lai, X., "On the design and security of block ciphers", ETH Series in Information Processing, J.L. Massey (editor), Vol. 1, Hartung-Gorre Verlag Knostanz, Technische Hochschule (Zurich), 1992

record.description: TripleDES (DES-EDE, SP800-67 - 168 bit key derived from 192)
Reserved to avoid collision with Secret Key Encryption (see the "OpenPGP Secret Key Encryption (S2K Usage Octet)" registry and RFC-ietf-openpgp-crypto-refresh-13, Section 5.5.3)

registry.title: OpenPGP Hash Algorithms
registry.note: When registering a new hash algorithm, if the algorithm is also to be used with RSA signing schemes, it must also have an entry in the "OpenPGP Hash Algorithm Identifiers for RSA Signatures use of EMSA-PKCS1-v1_5 Padding" registry.

registry.title: OpenPGP Secret Key Encryption (S2K Usage Octet)

record.enc: v3 or v4 keys: [cleartext secrets || check(secrets)] v6 keys: [cleartext secrets]

record.value: Known symmetric cipher algo ID (see "OpenPGP Symmetric Key Algorithms" registry)

record.encparam: params-length (v6-only), cipher-algo, AEAD-mode, S2K-specifier-length (v6-only), S2K-specifier, nonce

registry.title: OpenPGP Signature Notation Data Subpacket Notation Flags
OpenPGP Signature Notation Data Subpacket Types
registry.note:
Notation names are arbitrary Unicode strings encoded in UTF-8. They reside in two namespaces: The IETF namespace and the user namespace.
This registry documents the IETF namespace. The names in this registry MUST NOT contain the "@" character (0x40), since the presence of that character indicates the user namespace.

registry.title: OpenPGP Key ID and Fingerprint
registry.note: When a new key version is defined, the "OpenPGP Key and Signature Versions" registry should also be updated.

record.description: Used for signed, encrypted, or compressed files.
Used for detached signatures, OpenPGP/MIME signatures, and cleartext signatures.
Hash algorithms used in some v4 cleartext signed messages

registry.title: OpenPGP ECC Curve OID and Usage
registry.note: When a new elliptic curve is registered for use with OpenPGP, it should also be added to the "OpenPGP ECC Curve-specific Wire Formats" registry. If it is used for ECDH, also add it to the "OpenPGP ECDH KDF and KEK Parameters" registry.

registry.title: OpenPGP Hash Algorithm Identifiers for RSA Signatures Use of EMSA-PKCS1-v1_5 Padding
OpenPGP Encrypted Message Packet Versions
registry.note: When a new version of SEIPD, PKESK, or SKESK are defined, consider also adding a corresponding flag to the "OpenPGP Features Flags" registry.

registry.title: OpenPGP Key and Signature Versions
registry.note: When a new key version is defined, the "OpenPGP Key ID and Fingerprint" registry should also be updated.

registry.title: OpenPGP Elliptic Curve Point Wire Formats

record.description: An integer, big-endian encoded as a standard OpenPGP MPI
An octet string of fixed length, that may be shorter on the wire due to leading zeros being stripped by the MPI encoding, and may need to be zero-padded before use
An octet string of fixed length N, prefixed with octet 0x40 to ensure no leading zero octet

registry.title: OpenPGP ECDH KDF and KEK Parameters
